meanings.definition: Cause to feel distressed or humiliated.
meanings.sent1: His harsh words were chagrining her deeply.
meanings.sent2: She was chagrining over her mistake all night.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter kept chagrining the customers with his spills.
meanings.sent4: The constant criticism chagrined her spirit like a heavy weight.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her failure chagrined her every time she thought about it.

meanings.sent1: He was chagrining after being scolded in front of everyone.
meanings.sent2: She chagrined at the thought of having to apologize again.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked chagrined after knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The lost competition left her chagrined and disappointed.
meanings.sent5: The embarrassing moment at the party left him chagrining for days.
